abstract: Google and Yahoo could announce a decision to walk away from their search deal by the middle of next week, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.
lead_paragraph: Google and Yahoo could announce a decision to walk away from their search deal by the middle of next week, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: Google and Yahoo May Walk Away from Deal, Report Says

abstract: Just in time for holiday shopping, Google shows more ads above search results while banks try to turn cellphones into credit cards.
snippet: Just in time for holiday shopping, Google shows more ads above search results while banks try to turn cellphones into credit cards.
lead_paragraph: Google Slashes Marketing Budget Heading Into Downturn

headline.main: Quick Bits: Google Ads Will Be More Prominent

abstract: After another week of intense discussions, the Google-Yahoo advertising partnership isn’t dead yet.
snippet: After another week of intense discussions, the Google-Yahoo advertising partnership isn’t dead yet.
lead_paragraph: It’s been no secret that the advertising partnership between Google and Yahoo is in a great deal of trouble. The Justice Department, which has been investigating the deal for weeks, has raised concerns about its effect on competition. The companies have agreed to postpone its implementation multiple times, to give regulators more time to finish their investigation, and to see if they can reach a compromise that would address those concerns.

headline.main: Google-Yahoo Ad Deal Remains in Limbo
